title: As Tanks Rolled Into Ukraine, So Did Malware. Then Microsoft Entered the War.
abstract: After years of talks about the need for public-private partnerships to combat cyberattacks, the war in Ukraine is stress-testing the system.
byline: By David E. Sanger, Julian E. Barnes and Kate Conger

multimedia.caption: Ukrainians gather in a train station in Kyiv in an effort to leave the city shortly after the Russian invasion began.

title: ‘My Cousins Are Killing One Another’: War in Ukraine Splits Mixed Families
abstract: Because of their countries’ complex and intertwined history, many Ukrainians and Russians have relatives who are standing on opposite sides of the conflict.

multimedia.caption: Alona Cherkassky with her Russian mother and Ukrainian father in 1982. Ms. Cherkassky grew up in Moscow but spent her summers in Odessa, Ukraine.
Alona Cherkassky with her Russian mother and Ukrainian father in 1982. Ms. Cherkassky grew up in Moscow but spent her summers in Odessa, Ukraine.

title: A Bad Start for Russia
abstract: But many experts are worried about what happens next.

title: Joining Sanctions on Russia, Italy Risks More Than Most
abstract: The two countries have had strong economic ties for decades, but the invasion of Ukraine has spurred the government in Rome to realign with European allies — at an outsize cost.

multimedia.caption: A protest against the Russian invasion of Ukraine in Rome on Sunday. Russia could cut off natural gas supplies to Italy in retaliation for sanctions.
A protest against the Russian invasion of Ukraine in Rome on Sunday. Russia could cut off natural gas supplies to Italy in retaliation for sanctions.
A protest against the Russian invasion of Ukraine in Rome on Sunday. Russia could cut off natural gas supplies to Italy in retaliation for sanctions.

title: Valery Gergiev, a Putin Ally, Fired as Chief Conductor in Munich
abstract: The conductor was dismissed from the Munich Philharmonic after he refused to denounce Putin’s invasion of Ukraine. He and Anna Netrebko, the Russian diva, were also fired by the Bavarian State Opera.

multimedia.caption: The conductor Valery Gergiev has lost many international engagements since Russia’s invasion of Ukraine. He led the London Symphony Orchestra in New York in 2015.
multimedia.copyright: Hiroyuki Ito for The New York Times

title: Ukrainian Invasion Adds to Chaos for Global Supply Chains
abstract: Russia’s military incursion is severing key supply chains and setting off a scramble among global companies to comply with new sanctions.

multimedia.caption: A forklift carried steel sheets at the port in Mykolaiv, Ukraine, last month. The Russian invasion is disrupting global supply chains.
multimedia.copyright: Brendan Hoffman for The New York Times
